summary: The 'All Aboard Act of 2025' aims to bolster the US rail system. It establishes a formula grant program for states to develop rail plans, electrify infrastructure and expand passenger rail, especially high-performance services. The bill also creates a Green Railroads Fund for electrified rail operations and authorizes funds for Amtrak, railroad crossing elimination, and restoration projects. It addresses air quality concerns, establishes workforce training centers, and aims to modernize and expand rail infrastructure for both passenger and freight services, with a focus on zero-emission technologies and climate resilience.
